byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut and Istanbul, and Tim Arango from Baghdad. Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and TIM ARANGO

abstract: News Analysis; growth of Islamic State has been fueled by dual strategy of presenting itself as champion of Sunni Muslims while it brutally attacks any other Sunni group that may serve as alternative; analysts say success of strategy has underscored need for political component to military tactics being used by United States-led coalition.
lead_paragraph: Amid punishing American-backed airstrikes, the Islamic State militants have used a strategy of persuasion and violence to advance in Iraq and Syria.

headline.main: Using Violence and Persuasion, ISIS Makes Political Gains

snippet: Amid punishing American-backed airstrikes, the Islamic State militants have used a strategy of persuasion and violence to advance in Iraq and Syria.
